Comment: TLDR:  * A bill proposed in the Indiana State Senate no longer requires consent to be taught as part of sex education. * The alterations on Senate Bill 442, which proposes a more regulated version of sexual education in Indiana, were made Monday, April 21 by State Sen. Gary Byrne, [*IndyStar*](https://www.indystar.com/story/news/politics/2025/04/21/indiana-general-assembly-bill-consent-human-sexuality-legislative-session/83193928007/) reported. Byrne noted that the choice to teach students about consent would be left to local school boards, to accommodate "different thoughts in different communities." * "That \[consent education\] can still happen. We're not going to require it in this bill," Byrne said, per the outlet. "This is a sensitive subject for many." He added, "This leaves, for the most part, local control on making those decisions."
